channel.title: i don`t get it (copied disc)
channel.description: if by copying a disc you transfer all data to a blank disc,how can a console recognize a copied disc?

item.title: i don`t get it (copied disc)
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
Oh ok.
I don’t know about other consoles, but on the xbox 360, when games are written to disc, they also write an arrangement of invalid sectors, which the console will check for before running the game. These invalid sectors are unemulatable with a home DVD burner.

Read full topic

item.title: i don`t get it (copied disc)
item.dc:creator: felipedomaul
item.description:
wheybags:

What console are you trying to run? You’ll need special ripping and burning tools, and also a modded console.

i was just curious :p,i get quite philosophical sometimes

Read full topic

item.title: i don`t get it (copied disc)
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
felipedomaul:

if by copying a disc you transfer all data to a blank disc,how can a console recognize a copied disc?

The consoles are rigged by their companies to not read burned discs. They look for signatures on the disk and such. You need to mod you console with either software or hardware for it to work. Most consoles your going to need to mod hardware i.e. a mod chip.

Read full topic
